question: The "Lake Edward" is located on the border between which two African nations?
option3: Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda
answer: Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda
explanation: Lake Edward is the smallest of the African Great Lakes. It is located on the border between Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda. It is a part of the Albertine Rift of the East African Rift. This lake is also known as Edward Nyanza or Rulanzige. From 1973 to 1979, it was known as Lake Idi Amin. In 2018, this lake was a site for a naval skirmish between Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda.
